Reduced traffic congestion: With fewer cars on the road, traffic congestion would decrease significantly, leading to faster travel times and improved air quality.
Increased physical activity: If all cars were replaced with bicycles, more people would be encouraged to exercise, leading to a healthier population.
Economic benefits: The production and maintenance of bicycles would create new jobs and stimulate economic growth.
Reduced carbon emissions: Bicycles do not emit carbon emissions, so replacing cars with bicycles would significantly reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
Improved city design: Without cars, cities would be designed with more pedestrian and cycling infrastructure, leading to more livable and sustainable communities.
